triples.name: Human-agent team
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a human-centered approach to human-agent teamwork, which is a core system composed of interacting humans and artificial intelligence systems.

triples.name: Adjustable autonomy
triples.relevance: The paper introduces adjustable autonomy as a key mechanism for enabling varying degrees of autonomous agent control in human-agent collaboration.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: Autonomous agents are essential components of the human-agent teams that the paper designs for space and collaborative work environments.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper uses multi-agent system principles as the underlying framework for modeling interactions between multiple human and agent participants.

triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: Agent-based modeling is used by the paper to simulate realistic work situations involving human-agent teams.

triples.name: Software agent
triples.relevance: Software agents are designed and integrated into the proposed human-agent teamwork system for collaborative work in space.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: Robotic agents are a key component of the human-agent teams being designed and simulated for space missions and automation.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: Intelligent agents form the foundation of the autonomous systems that the paper integrates into human-agent teamwork frameworks.

triples.name: Human-computer interaction
triples.relevance: The paper employs human-centered human-computer interaction principles to design effective collaboration between human users and autonomous agents.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Robotics principles are applied in the design and simulation of robotic agents for human-agent teamwork in space environments.
